UnitTestShouldUseAfterAnnotation.description:
Description

This rule detects methods calledtearDown()that are not properly annotated as a cleanup method.
This is primarily intended to assist in upgrading from JUnit 3, where tear down methods were required to be calledtearDown().
To a lesser extent, this may help detect omissions even under newer JUnit versions or under TestNG,
as long as you are following this convention to name the methods.

Note: This rule was named JUnit4TestShouldUseAfterAnnotation before PMD 7.7.0.

Example(s):

Use this rule by referencing it:
UnitTestShouldUseAfterAnnotation.option: This rule has no specific options.
